title: Leicester players tell club chiefs they are willing to work with former boss Nigel Pearson
text:
Sport Leicester players tell club chiefs they are willing to work with former boss Nigel Pearson Pearson was sacked by the Foxes after guiding them to safety in 2015 when he fell out with club bosses Share The Leicester squad are ready to work with Pearson again (Photo: PA) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Leicester's players have told club chiefs they would be willing to work with former boss Nigel Pearson. 
Pearson is one of a number of names being considered as the Foxes seek a replacement for Claudio Ranieri whose sacking stunned football on Thursday. Pearson led Leicester to Premier League safety in 2015, putting together a remarkable run which saw them win seven of their final nine games. 
He was fired in the summer of 2015 after a breakdown in his relationship with club chiefs. 
Although he is not top of the shortlist, the players, who complained to the club’s owner about Ranieri, would be open to his return to the King Power. Pearson kept Leicester up in 2015 (Photo: Plumb Images) Read More Leicester chief Srivaddhanaprabha explains why he sacked Ranieri 
One manager who is high on Leicester’s list is Roberto Mancini, who briefly played for the Foxes in 2001. 
Mancini had been harbouring hopes of landing a job back in England, but has now been linked with replacing Vincenzo Montella at AC Milan. 
The Italians are seventh in Serie A and Montella is set to pay the price for a poor season. The club’s new Chinese investors believe Mancini can bring back the glory days. Mancini spent a month at Leicester as a player (Photo: PA) 
Mancini joined Leicester on loan at the end of his playing career, but was so unhappy in the city that he returned to Italy after a month. 
And the ruthless way Leicester’s Thai owners have treated his friend Ranieri has also raised doubts. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
